title: 105_s1291
content: The Act may be cited as the "Interstate Distribution of State-Inspected Meat Act of 1997" and includes a waiver of intrastate distribution limitation. The "Interstate Distribution of State-Inspected Meat Act of 1997" includes a waiver of intrastate distribution limitation, allowing State agencies to apply for evaluation by the Secretary to ensure their meat inspection program meets Federal requirements. The Secretary may waive the limitation on intrastate distribution for State-inspected meat if their program meets Federal requirements. Random inspections may be conducted by the Secretary to ensure compliance. The State's meat inspection program must comply with Federal requirements, and inspectors can be employees of the Department of Agriculture or trained State employees. Noncompliance with inspection and sanitation requirements will be addressed. If the State's meat inspection program does not meet Federal requirements, the Secretary will restrict interstate distribution of meat until compliance is verified. Poultry inspection regulations under the Poultry Products Inspection Act are also amended. The Secretary will evaluate a State's poultry inspection program to ensure it meets Federal requirements, and may waive intrastate distribution limitations if the program is equivalent to Federal standards. The Secretary may waive intrastate distribution limitations for State-inspected poultry if the program meets Federal requirements. Random inspections may be conducted to ensure compliance with inspection, reinspection, and sanitation standards. The State's poultry inspection program must comply with Federal requirements. Inspectors can be employees of the Department of Agriculture or trained State employees. Noncompliance with inspection and sanitation standards will be addressed. The Secretary will reimpose restrictions on interstate distribution of poultry and poultry products from a plant until a subsequent inspection verifies compliance with State's poultry inspection program to the same degree as Federal requirements. The Act and its amendments will be effective on December 1, 1997.
